sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The arcsind function is used to find the arc sine of an angle given in degrees. For example, arcsind (0.5) is 30.
sections.text_content: The arcsind function is used to find the arc sine of an angle given in degrees. For example, arcsind (0.5) is 30.
sections.mdown_content: The **arcsind** function is used to find the arc sine of an angle given in degrees. For example, **arcsind** (0.5) is 30.

sections.title: Example
code:
for i : -4 .. 4
            const arg := i / 4
            put "Arc sine of ", arg, " is ",
                arcsind (arg), " degrees"
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints out the arcsine of values from -1 to 1 in degrees.
sections.text_content: This program prints out the arcsine of values from -1 to 1 in degrees.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints out the arcsine of values from -1 to 1 in degrees.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
the arccosd and arctand functions for calculating arccosine and arctangent

the arcsin function which finds the arc sine of a value with the result given in radians. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)

See also predefined unit Math.
sections.text_content:
the arccosd and arctand functions for calculating arccosine and arctangent
the arcsin function which finds the arc sine of a value with the result given in radians. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)
See also predefined unit Math.
sections.mdown_content:
the **[arccosd.html](arccosd)** and **[arctand.html](arctand)** functions for calculating arccosine and arctangent
the **[arcsin.html](arcsin)** function which finds the arc sine of a value with the result given in radians. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)
See also predefined unit **[mathmodule.html](Math)**.
